snippet: After President Bingu wa Mutharika’s death was announced, his vice president, Joyce Banda, was sworn in as his successor.
abstract: Malawi’s vice president, Joyce Banda, is sworn in as president, ending a tense 36 hours of speculation and confusion about the future of one of central Africa’s most enduring democracies after the death of President Bingu wa Mutharika.

byline.contributor: Peter Jegwa Kumwenda contributed reporting from Lilongwe, Malawi.

lead_paragraph: After President Bingu wa Mutharika’s death was announced, his vice president, Joyce Banda, was sworn in as his successor.

headline.seo: Malawi’s Second in Command Sworn In as President
headline.main: In Mourning, Malawi Swears In a New President
headline.print_headline: In Mourning, Malawi Gets New Leader
